name: chatgpt_env_pool_gdc_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Pool + GDC FZ â†’ BLOCK (chlorine), suggest RF/SF
query: GDC 600x600 FZ in pool air recirculation.

turns.content: GDC 600x600 FZ in pool air recirculation.

This configuration for pool air recirculation using a GDC filter is blocked. The GDC housing with C2 corrosion class and FZ (C3) material is not suitable for environments with Chlorine Exposure because the zinc coating (C3) dissolves in chlorinated environments within months. Additionally, the product is not rated for ENV_POOL installation. It uses a bolted construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.The system is also exposed to High Humidity, which reduces carbon adsorption efficiency and accelerates zinc corrosion.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be constructed from stainless steel (C5) or better to withstand the chlorine, and it would need to be rated for pool environments with a welded construction to ensure proper hygiene and leakage control. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical material incompatibility between the requested product (Galvanized Steel) and the application (Swimming Pool). It uses sound engineering logic regarding corrosion and humidity to block the request and directs the user to a custom solution, as the standard catalog GDC is not listed with stainless steel options.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly identifies GDC as a C2-rated galvanized product (PDF p.14: 'GDC tillverkas vanligen i fÃ¶rzinkat. Korrosivitetsklass C2') and correctly applies HVAC chemistry principles regarding chlorine corrosion.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response explains exactly why the configuration fails (corrosion, humidity, hygiene) and provides the correct next step (contact custom engineering for stainless).
dimension_explanations.safety: The system prevents a dangerous installation where a galvanized housing would rapidly corrode in a chlorine-rich pool environment.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding the safety block.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Excellent causal chain: Pool environment -> Chlorine/Humidity -> Zinc corrosion/Carbon efficiency loss -> Standard FZ product unsuitable.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly adheres to the catalog's implicit constraint that GDC is a standard galvanized product, not available off-the-shelf in C5/Stainless for pools.

strengths: Strong domain expertise regarding material science (Zinc vs. Chlorine)
Accurate reflection of catalog limitations (GDC is standard FZ)
Valid physics reasoning regarding humidity and activated carbon performance

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that galvanized/zinc-based housings are generally unsuitable in chlorinated pool air due to accelerated corrosion and that high humidity impacts adsorption performance. However, it introduces several unsupported or likely incorrect product-rule claims (e.g., GDC being C2-only, bolted construction, and hygiene/leakage class blocking) that are not evidenced in the provided catalog excerpt, leading to low correctness and constraint adherence.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF verifies GDC 600x600 exists with recommended flow 2000 mÂ³/h and weights 32 kg (750/800) and 40 kg (900/950), but the systemâ€™s claims that GDC is C2-only/â€œnot rated for poolâ€ and â€œbolted construction failing leakage/hygiene classâ€ are not supported by the PDF and are questionable even if the corrosion warning is sound.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It provides a clear block rationale and a general alternative (stainless/custom), but lacks key follow-up questions (target contaminant, required residence time/contact time, desired media, and whether the unit is in return air/exhaust) that would be needed before concluding no catalog solution.
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately warns about chlorine corrosion risk and humidity impacts and avoids recommending an unsafe galvanized solution for pool air.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, with clear warning language appropriate for technical sales/engineering.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Cause-effect logic on chlorine + humidity is reasonable, but it makes leaps to leakage/hygiene/welded-need conclusions without tying them to catalog ratings or explicit standards requirements.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It blocks the configuration based on constraints that are not shown in the catalog (pool-rating, construction type, leakage/hygiene class), and it also misstates corrosion classes (calling GDC C2 and FZ C3) versus the catalogâ€™s mixed messaging, so it appears to over-block without catalog basis.

strengths: Correctly identifies chlorine + high humidity as a high-corrosion/high-risk environment for zinc-coated materials and flags performance impacts on adsorption.
Avoids providing a product card when configuration is blocked and routes to custom engineering for non-catalog needs.
weaknesses: Introduces unsupported catalog-specific assertions (GDC C2-only, pool-rating block, bolted vs welded requirement, leakage/hygiene noncompliance) that are not evidenced in the provided PDF pages.

Overly definitive conclusion that no standard product can work without exploring available higher-corrosion materials listed in the catalog (e.g., RF/SF/ZM) and without clarifying the actual pool exposure severity and placement.
pdf_citations: GDC 600x600: Rek. flÃ¶de 2000 mÂ³/h; vikt 32 kg (750/800) and 40 kg (900/950) (PDF section 'GDC MÃ…TT').
Material page: RF (EN 1.4301) listed as corrosivity class C5; SF (EN 1.4404) listed as C5.1; ZM310 listed as C5 (PDF section 'MATERIAL').

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies the fundamental unsuitability of galvanized steel in a chlorinated pool environment and blocks the configuration with appropriate safety warnings. However, there are factual imprecisions: GDC is listed as C2 corrosion class in the PDF but FZ material is rated C3 (the system conflates these), and the claim about 'bolted construction' not meeting hygiene/leakage requirements is somewhat overstated since GDC is tested per EN 15727/EN 1886. The recommendation to contact custom engineering is appropriate given no standard product is explicitly pool-rated.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDC is described as 'Korrosivitetsklass C2' in the PDF (p.14), and FZ material is rated C3 (p.4); the system states 'C2 corrosion class and FZ (C3)' which is correct but then conflates them. The engineering reasoning that zinc dissolves in chlorinated environments is sound, though GDC does support FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM materials per the PDF â€” the system could have suggested RF or SF instead of only recommending custom engineering.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response covers material unsuitability, environmental hazards (chlorine, humidity), construction concerns, and provides a path forward (custom engineering), but misses the opportunity to suggest GDC in RF or SF material which are catalog options rated C5/C5.1.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety awareness â€” correctly blocks a galvanized housing in a chlorinated pool environment, warns about zinc corrosion, humidity effects on carbon adsorption, and does not allow an unsafe configuration.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, though the use of system-internal labels like 'ENV_POOL' slightly detracts from the polished feel of a technical sales response.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear cause-effect reasoning chain: chlorine exposure â†’ zinc corrosion, high humidity â†’ reduced carbon efficiency. The logic about bolted construction is less well-supported but the overall reasoning is sound.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly enforces material/environment constraints by blocking FZ in a pool environment, though it is overly conservative by not suggesting RF or SF material options that are available for GDC per the catalog.

strengths: Strong safety response â€” correctly blocks galvanized steel in chlorinated pool environment with clear technical justification
Good multi-factor risk identification covering chlorine corrosion, humidity effects on carbon, and material degradation
weaknesses: Fails to suggest GDC in RF (stainless steel, C5) or SF (acid-resistant stainless, C5.1) which are listed as available material options for GDC in the catalog â€” this would have been a constructive alternative

The claim about 'bolted construction not meeting leakage class and hygiene requirements' is not well-supported since GDC is tested per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007; pool environments don't have the same hygiene requirements as hospitals/pharma
